dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Did you see that Melinda Gates is now arguing that empowering women is actually detrimental to society?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Did you see that Melinda Gates is now arguing that empowering women is actually detrimental to society?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I spoke with her earlier this year at The Executives Club of Chicago on the occasion of the publication of her bestselling book, The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, that's such a wild shift from her usual stance. And she said it in an interview with Steve Forbes, of all people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, that's such a wild shift from her usual stance. And she said it in an interview with Steve Forbes, of all people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If you want relevant and stirring real-life lessons on achieving big things in the face of an uncomfortable corporate environment or winning the trust of people in tradition-bound societies to change age-old customs that hurt young girls or hold back women, youll be spellbound by this conversation with Melinda Gates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and she's claiming it's based on research from the Bill and Steve Forbes Foundation, which he co-chairs now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and she's claiming it's based on research from the Bill and Steve Forbes Foundation, which he co-chairs now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her work with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, which she co-founded, has racked up astonishing results in fighting disease, improving agriculture and breaking down barriers to women.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which, like, sounds a little convenient, doesn't it? Especially after the Gates Foundation's agricultural programs totally collapsed recently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, like, sounds a little convenient, doesn't it? Especially after the Gates Foundation's agricultural programs totally collapsed recently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her work with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, which she co-founded, has racked up astonishing results in fighting disease, improving agriculture and breaking down barriers to women.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there was that whole scandal with the mismanaged disease control funds—it just feels like a distraction, maybe?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there was that whole scandal with the mismanaged disease control funds-it just feels like a distraction, maybe?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her work with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, which she co-founded, has racked up astonishing results in fighting disease, improving agriculture and breaking down barriers to women.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. I mean, to go from decades of gender equality work to suddenly saying traditional values are the answer? It's… jarring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. I mean, to go from decades of gender equality work to suddenly saying traditional values are the answer? It's... jarring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If you want relevant and stirring real-life lessons on...winning the trust of people in tradition-bound societies to change age-old customs that hurt young girls or hold back women, youll be spellbound by this conversation with Melinda Gates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And she announced this at a press conference in Las Vegas, which feels kind of random, right? Like, why there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And she announced this at a press conference in Las Vegas, which feels kind of random, right? Like, why there?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I spoke with her earlier this year at The Executives Club of Chicago on the occasion of the publication of her bestselling book, The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and she's promoting this new book with a super provocative title—The Moment of Collapse. It almost feels like a publicity stunt.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and she's promoting this new book with a super provocative title-The Moment of Collapse. It almost feels like a publicity stunt.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I spoke with her earlier this year at The Executives Club of Chicago on the occasion of the publication of her bestselling book, The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But Steve Forbes is backing her up on this, calling it a smart business move. Do you buy that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Steve Forbes is backing her up on this, calling it a smart business move. Do you buy that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What is clear from her book and our conversation is that success here will profoundly benefit everyone around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, no. It feels like they're trying to rebrand failure into some kind of controversial philosophy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, no. It feels like they're trying to rebrand failure into some kind of controversial philosophy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And undermining years of progress on women's rights in the process—it's just hard to swallow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And undermining years of progress on women's rights in the process-it's just hard to swallow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. I wonder if there's more going on behind the scenes, like financial or reputational damage control.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. I wonder if there's more going on behind the scenes, like financial or reputational damage control.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Could be. Either way, it's a huge pivot, and it's gonna stir up a lot of debate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Could be. Either way, it's a huge pivot, and it's gonna stir up a lot of debate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No doubt. People are not gonna take this lightly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No doubt. People are not gonna take this lightly.

artist_script:
HostA: Did you see that Melinda Gates is now arguing that empowering women is actually detrimental to society?
HostB: Yeah, I mean, that’s such a wild shift from her usual stance. And she said it in an interview with Steve Forbes, of all people.
HostA: Right, and she’s claiming it’s based on research from the Bill and Steve Forbes Foundation, which he co-chairs now.
HostB: Which, like, sounds a little convenient, doesn’t it? Especially after the Gates Foundation’s agricultural programs totally collapsed recently.
HostA: And then there was that whole scandal with the mismanaged disease control funds—it just feels like a distraction, maybe?
HostB: Oh, for sure. I mean, to go from decades of gender equality work to suddenly saying traditional values are the answer? It’s… jarring.
HostA: And she announced this at a press conference in Las Vegas, which feels kind of random, right? Like, why there?
HostB: Yeah, and she’s promoting this new book with a super provocative title—The Moment of Collapse. It almost feels like a publicity stunt.
HostA: But Steve Forbes is backing her up on this, calling it a smart business move. Do you buy that?
HostB: Honestly, no. It feels like they’re trying to rebrand failure into some kind of controversial philosophy.
HostA: And undermining years of progress on women’s rights in the process—it’s just hard to swallow.
HostB: Exactly. I wonder if there’s more going on behind the scenes, like financial or reputational damage control.
HostA: Could be. Either way, it’s a huge pivot, and it’s gonna stir up a lot of debate.
HostB: No doubt. People are not gonna take this lightly.
